p: The human studies evaluating the IFN-I response to WNV infection and its relationship with disease severity are scarce [ 245]. Recently, a study with WNV-infected blood donors revealed that symptom development was positively correlated with early, potent IFN- Î± production [ 246]. However, this robust IFN-I response was associated with an inability to maintain continuing immunity during WNV infection, suggesting that an increased initial inflammation may negatively impact the adaptive-T cell responses.
